lines.line: Hi there. Looks like you're in some trouble.
The cart? That's the least of my problems. I've got to find my family...
Your family? Can I help?
You'd be willing to?
Of course. Tell me what happened.
Well, I'm Lady Servil. I was travelling to Ardougne with my husband, Justin, and son, Sammy, when our cart broke on some rocks.
Some of General Khazard's men spotted us and offered to help, but they demanded my husband and son fight in their arena first! We said no, but they took them anyway!
General Khazard?

He's a menace! This entire area is under the control of him and his mercenary group, the Khazard Army. They prey on the weak and vulnerable, making them fight in that arena of theirs, all for entertainment!
That's horrible! How are they able to get away with it?
The authorities don't care. Khazard's men just pay them off if they ever come to investigate.
Well they won't stop me. I'm going to try my best to find your family.
Thank you. They'll be somewhere inside the arena. I'll be waiting here for you.
Well I hope it works out. Good luck.
Adventurer, please... bring back my family. They'll be somewhere inside the arena.
Don't worry, I'll find them.
Hello.
Hello, stranger. Are you here for the fight arena?
I suppose I am.
Anything in particular?
Just visiting some friends.
Inside? Are you sure about that? Only Khazard guards are allowed in there. Unless you know where to get some of their armour, you won't be visiting anyone.
Can I help you?
I'm not sure.
Well I'm off-duty right now, so why don't you go and bother someone else.
Hello Lady Servil.
Have you had any luck with freeing my family?
I've managed to get a guard's uniform, hopefully I can infiltrate the arena.
Please hurry.
Despicable thieving scum!
What happened?
None of your business. Clear off!
Someone came in and stole my armour!
Oh no! I'll let you know if I see anyone suspicious...
Are you new? I've never seen you around here before.
You could say that. Long live General Khazard!
Er... yeah...
There should be some good fights today.
Keep an eye out for anything suspicious.
I think I'll head to the bar on my next break.
Don't bother me while I'm on duty.
Hello there. I hear the Servil family are fighting soon. Should be very entertaining.
What are you doing here? Leave at once!
This door appears to be locked.
Nice observation guard. You could have just asked to be let in like a normal person.
Do either of you know of the Servil family?
If we did, why would we tell a guard?
Until our last breath, our every action will be against Khazard. Never will we help you.
I spit on Khazard, and all who do his bidding.
I've heard of them, but if your hope is to help them, I fear you may be too late.
You should leave while you can. If the guards get you, you'll be in here next.
Hello there. I'm looking for the Servil family.
Please leave me alone.
I've never heard of them.
Hello there.
Hmm... You don't seem like a real guard to me. Who are you?
No one important. I'm looking for the Servil family.
I've seen them in here, but my advice to you is to leave them. Whatever plan you have will only end with you in a cell as well.
You're not a guard. What are you doing in here?
I'm looking for the Servil family.
Long live General Khazard!
Er... yes... quite right. Did you need something?
Just checking if you have any orders for me.
Not right now. Things are all very boring at the moment. What I'd give to be over at the bar having a nice Khali brew...
Khali brew? Can't say I've ever had one.
Oh, nothing beats them! Mind you, don't make the mistake of having too many. Last time I did, I ended up falling straight to sleep.
Good to know, thanks.
Hello again.
What a boring day. You'd think the slaves would be more entertaining.
Not long now until you get a break though, right?
Too right! Then it's straight to the bar for a nice Khali brew.
This area is restricted. Leave now!
Hello. Are you Sammy?
Please... don't hurt me.
Don't worry, I'm here to help. Where do they keep the keys?
The Head Guard has them. He's the one with the big sword.
Don't lose heart, I'll be back.
Hello, Sammy.
Hello. Do you have the keys?
Not yet.
Please hurry. The Head Guard has them. He's the one with the big sword.
Lady Servil, I have managed to infiltrate General Khazard's arena.
And my family?
I'm working on it.
Please hurry.
Are you okay?
Get away! One day we'll have our revenge on you all!
Spare us your fake pity. I spit on Khazard, and all who do his bidding.
You're not safe here, traveller. Leave while you still can.
You're brave coming in here. If the guards get you, you'll be the next one in a cell.
Why am I here?
What did I do to deserve this?
You're not safe here. Leave while you can.
No one important.
If you say so.
Nothing important.
Hi, what can I get you? We have a range of quality brews.
I'd like a Khali brew please.
That'll be five gold coins please.
Oh, I don't have enough money with me.
Oh, I don't have enough room for one.
There you go, that's five gold coins. I suggest lying down before you drink it. That way you have less distance to collapse.
Do you still fancy a drink?
I really shouldn't...
Are you sure?
Oh... okay then, but just the one.
That is some gooood stuff... yeah... wooh, yeah!
Are you alright?
Yeesshh! Oooh, maybe I sshould relax for a while.
Good idea. I'll look after the prisoners.
Yeesh... that shounds reasonable. Here, take the keysch. Any trouble, you give... you give 'em a good beating.
Don't worry, I'll keep them in line
Pleash... leave me alone. Did the walls always shway soooo much?
Hi, er... I lost the keys.
What? You're foolish... and I'm all drunk. Here... takes my shpare shh... set!
Thish areash resh... restricted! We don't like strangersh... 'specially ones who sway. Oooh!
The gate is locked, but Sammy's not in there anyway.
Sammy look, I have the keys.
Wow! Please hurry and set me free.
We'll need to wait for the guards to change shift, but don't worry, you'll be out soon...
Alright, the coast is clear.
Now, let's get you out of here.
Not yet! We need to find my dad!
Sammy, wait!
Quick, help him!
Hello there. I hear Khazard's got some great fights lined up today. I can't wait!
Hello, stranger. I hear Khazard's got some great fights lined up today. I can't wait!
Lady Servil, I freed your son, but he went to help your husband.
No! Please, you have to help them!
Well, well, well, you seem to be in quite the rush. Do you have somewhere else to be?
Oh no...
General Khazard, I presume?
You presume correct. I must say, I sense a great air of defiance to you. Does my appearance not fill you with fear?
I've seen worse.
How arrogant. No matter though, you will come to learn.
Now, despite your entertaining show, the two individuals you are attempting to leave with are my property.
They belong to nobody!
Ha! Well if their freedom is so valuable to you, how about a trade? Fight in my arena, and if you win, I'll let them go.
And what if I refuse your offer?
Well... I wasn't actually giving you a choice. Guards, take them to the cells.
Hey, you're the one from the arena! That was some great fighting!
So you're back for more are you? General Khazard will be pleased.
Hello there. So Khazard got his hands on you too?
Unfortunately so.
Well if you're lucky, you might last as long as me.
How long have you been here?
As long as I can remember. I was a child when his men kidnapped me. My whole life has been spent killing and fighting, all in the hope that one day I might escape.
Don't give up.
Thanks, friend.
Wait... sounds like the guard is coming. Looks like you'll be going back into the arena. Good luck, friend.
Now watch closely, friends. I fear this may be where your protector dies.
Ignore him! You can do it!
I don't know how you managed to escape, but you may not be as lucky next time. Get out of here while you can.
Impressive, but now for a proper challenge. Time for my puppy. Bring on Bouncer!
Bouncer! No!
You monster! You'll pay for what you've done!
I only did what you asked. I fought in your arena. Now let the Servils go.
Fine! I am not a coward who makes false promises. I have no need of them anyway. You on the other hand, won't be going anywhere.
Guard, escort the Servils out. I'll take great pleasure in dealing with this one myself!
Don't try to fight him! Just run!
You! You're the one who killed Bouncer.
Die you monster!
Hey, you're the one who beat Bouncer! Amazing!
Going somewhere?
But... I killed you!
Ha! Arrogant fool! You think you can kill me? I am General Khazard! My power is absolute!
Now, part of me would very much like to kill you for what you've done today, but let it be known that I am not without generosity.
You proved yourself in battle against me. That is something few can boast of. For that, you may leave. However, if you ever oppose me again, I won't hesitate to wipe you from existence!
Now go. I have business to attend to elsewhere that is far more important than you.
Lady Servil.
You're alive! I feared General Khazard would have killed you!
He tried, but I escaped.
Thank goodness. I'd have never forgiven myself if you'd have died saving my family.
Now, you'll be pleased to know that my son and husband are safe and recovering at home. Without you they would certainly be dead. Thank you, for everything.
It's not a problem.
Please, take this payment. It's the least you deserve.
He tried, but I was able to defeat him.
You killed General Khazard?
I thought I had at first, but it seems he is not that easy to kill.
Well, at least you're alive.

characters.name: Lady Servil
characters.description: Middle-aged female, refined British accent, dignified yet desperate tone. A wealthy noblewoman of Kandarin, worried and pleading for her family's rescue from General Khazard's arena.

characters.name: General Khazard
characters.description: Ancient male, deep commanding voice with an otherworldly menacing quality. An immortal Mahjarrat warlord - arrogant, calculating, and cruel, yet honors his word when defeated in combat.

characters.name: Sammy Servil
characters.description: Youthful male around 12-14 years old, frightened and vulnerable tone. A young squire and son of nobles, imprisoned and scared but brave enough to help rescue his father.

characters.name: Justin Servil
characters.description: Middle-aged male, noble British accent, worn but encouraging tone. A Kandarin nobleman held captive, weakened from imprisonment but still supportive of his rescuer.

characters.name: Hengrad
characters.description: Adult male around 30, weary and resigned voice with underlying strength. A lifelong arena prisoner kidnapped as a youth, wise from years of survival but exhausted from endless fighting.

characters.name: Head Guard
characters.description: Middle-aged male, gruff military voice, bored and easily tempted. The chief prison guard who becomes comically drunk on Khali brew, slurring his words heavily.

characters.name: Khazard Guard
characters.description: Adult male, authoritative military tone, dismissive and suspicious. Standard soldiers of General Khazard's army - professional but not particularly bright.

characters.name: Door Guard
characters.description: Adult male, casual military voice, slightly awkward. A gate guard who isn't fully committed to Khazard's cause, responds unenthusiastically to zealous salutes.

characters.name: Khazard Barman
characters.description: Middle-aged male, rough working-class accent, matter-of-fact tone. A tough tavern keeper who serves Khazard's soldiers, with dry humor about his potent brews.

characters.name: Spectator
characters.description: Adult male, common British accent, eager and bloodthirsty. A scruffy arena spectator who enjoys watching the violent fights, casually enthusiastic about suffering.

characters.name: Joe
characters.description: Adult male, defiant and bitter voice, full of hatred. A mistreated arena slave who despises Khazard and his guards, speaks with fierce resistance.

characters.name: Kelvin
characters.description: Adult male, resolute and angry voice, unyielding spirit. A fellow slave alongside Joe, equally defiant against their captors despite their weakened state.

characters.name: Slave
characters.description: Adult, broken and despairing voice, barely holding on. Generic arena prisoners who have lost hope, speaking with fear and resignation about their fate.
